titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Petition for the widening of Henry Street 1974.162
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:18:59 +0000.

did.unittitle: Petition for the widening of Henry Street
did.abstract: A petition written by residents of Brooklyn, dated 1833, asking the President and Trustees of the Village of Brooklyn for the widening of Henry Street in the neighborhood of Brooklyn Heights. It is indicated on the document that this is a copy of the original petition. The names of the original creators are unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Petition for the widening of Henry Street, 1974.162, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.
